website_summaries.verdict: A highly durable, long-lasting striking tool designed for welding and chipping.
pros: Handle and head are one piece

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it.  A tool you'll have for a lifetime.
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was crazy to pay ~$25 for a chipping hammer. I've always used $5 Chinese slag hammers and they work, but the Estwing is a damn fine tool!! It's worth every penny. This is the nicest tool I own and when you take it out of the package flick your finger on it and it rings like a bell. Beautiful tool steel and made in the USA!! Perfectly beveled and you can get into tight spots within passes and scrape out stubborn slag. I think these are way better in quality than the wood handled Atlas brand - my buddy has one of those and he's constantly resharpening it.
customer_reviews.author: MarioBowser

customer_reviews.title: Darn fine chipping hammer!!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding chipping hammer for welders!! Made in the USA was initially what caught my eye but the quality of this hammer is excellent!! The point is excellent. The hammer has a good feel to it and overall is excellent. I have owned dozens of chipping hammers and this one leaves them all in the dust. Wooden handle junk that loosens up, hammer heads flying off, made in that other place where everything seems to be made. If you want a dynamite chipping hammer don't hesitate, pull the trigger on this one, you will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: PatTop Contributor: Welding

customer_reviews.title: Good old American quality
customer_reviews.text: I had a chipping hammer than cam with my welder - the ones with the spiral wire handle. used it for about 10 years but was getting tired of its lack of performance. customer_reviews.title: At first I felt stupid spending so much on a chipping hammer
